tweets.text:
Ironbridge temporary flood barriers going up tomorrow. 

Due to heavy rain across Shropshire & upper Severn, barriers are needed to protect communities from #flooding. 

Wharfage resurfacing prep work had started, however this work is postponed while the barriers are needed. https://t.co/sY7ue1o4Lf

We know it will happen, yet we still manage the hills to give them the water absorption capacity of tarmac. Stop burning & stop over-grazing to ensure our hills can absorb these storms. Sandbags are not the answer. @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/d5JSR8Ja5N

tweets.text:
Huge thank you to our operations staff, working round the clock putting up barriers, installing pumps, clearing debris etc. üôè

Behind the scenes we have 100s of staff across the country are monitoring rain & river levels. Taking action to help keep people safe. #FloodAware https://t.co/aDYZ3PhoYi

Ok that‚Äôs me on as @EnvAgencyNW duty manager for #Cumbria and #Lancashire for the night shift.  Lots of #TeamEA out in the wet and dark doing vital work to protect communities from #StormChristoph while others are monitoring river levels  https://t.co/U7kgP2AgP5

tweets.text:
More heavy rain is forecast overnight. Don‚Äôt take any unnecessary risks ‚Äì always avoid flood water. Check the flood risk in your area:  

https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#StormChristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/xHzsaCyYwu

Turn around, don't drown!

Remember just one egg cup of water is enough to wreck your engine, and just 15cm of moving water is enough to impact a small car.

Don't drive through floodwater.
@EnvAgency | @itvanglia | @itvweather https://t.co/Gt2T4L1Fj8

tweets.text: The Environment Agency's Pete Fox was in #Hebden Bridge today talking to media about the #flood warnings we'll be issuing across #Yorkshire and the steps people can take to prepare. Check for the latest warnings here, updated every 15 minutes: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/gEsE62Qkcx

*** FLOOD ALERT ***

The Environment Agency @EnvAgencyNW have issued a ‚ÄòFlooding is possible - be prepared‚Äô alert for areas iof Tameside. 

More details here:
https://t.co/txKTHfBfAx
With water levels rising and Storm Christoph on the way, we have been advised by @EnvAgencyMids will be deploying the flood barriers on the Wharfage in Ironbridge from 8am tomorrow #floodaware

#FloodWarnings are in force across England as a result of #StormChristoph. #TeamEA have been working 24/7 to keep our communities safe. Stay safe at home and find out what to do in a flood: https://t.co/X4IQl3fUIh  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/EkLRcEMncE

tweets.text: Just getting updated from @EnvAgencyNW #Cumbria and #Lancashire incident team and we are getting important gaps in the rain from #StormChristoph that allows rivers to recover, particularly where we have had heavy showers #wigton https://t.co/bvPGP7DSsQ
Heavy rain is expected from #StormChristoph tomorrow - as always sign up to our flood warning service Stay #floodaware https://t.co/xE8Rupk4ct https://t.co/oo3py0fuT1

There are #FloodWarnings in place as #StormChristoph brings heavy rain across England.  

Know what to do in a flood and check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7Fwblnq  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/MaE7ptFod2

Make sure you're following our partners for all of the latest info during #StormChristoph.

tweets.text: 30cm of flowing water is enough to move your car. Never drive through flood water. What to do during a flood: https://t.co/yOnoPDvQSt #prepareactsurvive https://t.co/YVW0JKGIql

Our teams are out and about across the #Midlands. These pics from Retford in #Notts where we have deployed mobile pumps to keep the local beck clear. Keep checking your #flood risk #StormChristoph 

https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/nxIixWG2wj

#TeamEA is out prepping for the further #rainfall heading out way. We‚Äôre checking our #flood risk assets, clearing debris washed down by previous #rain & putting up defences in #Bewdley & #Shrewsbury.

If you see our folk please keep your distance & help them stay #CovidSafe. https://t.co/yR7V6fnVvF

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Springwatch
entity.description: Following the fortunes of a cast of unforgettable wildlife characters at the climax of spring.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

domain.name: TV Episodes
